question:
Recently, India successfully test fired the nuclear-capable “Dhanush” ballistic missile. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Dhanush can carry a payload of 1500 kg and is capable of striking both land and sea-based targets in the range of 3500 km
  2. It has been developed by Defence Research Development Organisation (DRDO) under the Integrated Guided Missile Development Programme (IGMDP)
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is incorrect</u> because the striking capacity of the missile is in the range of 350 km. The missile is capable of carrying a payload of 500 kg and hitting both land and sea-based targets. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. Dhanush has been developed by the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) under the Integrated Guided Missile Development Programme (IGMDP).
